content.question: Which of the following correctly identifies particles <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"> <mi>X</mi> </math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi>Y</mi></math>? Particle <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi>X</mi></math> Particle <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi>Y</mi></math> A <math alttext="neutron" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>n</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>0</mn><mn>1</mn></mmultiscripts></math> <math alttext="alpha" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi></math> B <math alttext="neutron" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>n</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>0</mn><mn>1</mn></mmultiscripts></math> <math alttext="beta minus" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>β</mi><mo>−</mo></msup></math> C <math alttext="gamma" overflow="scroll"><mi>γ</mi></math> <math alttext="alpha" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi></math> D <math alttext="gamma" overflow="scroll"><mi>γ</mi></math> <math alttext="beta minus" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>β</mi><mo>−</mo></msup></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
